Key Arguments: The legislation impedes on freedom of speech and open discussions.
There is skepticism about who defines and controls misinformation and disinformation.
Concerns about government overreach and excessive control.
Potential for misuse of power and influence by large digital platforms.
Doubts about the effectiveness and necessity of the legislation given existing societal issues.
Fear of creating a culture of fear and over-caution among citizens.
Main Themes: Role of Media and Large Platforms
Notable Quotes: We should, instead of introducing a bill around very loose terminology such as misinformation and disinformation, be talking about the Freedom of Speech.
Who defines what is misinformation and disinformation? Who controls the enforcer and the controller?
ACMA will have too much power.
The bill needs to be cancelled.
